ai-tika-s0102t3:71_6: kings, Vajirā, King Abhaya, Nigaṇṭha, a great king,
ai-tika-s0102t3:72_0: The water flows, etc., and having a grass covered with a blade of grasses, etc., and the dripsing of grass,
ai-tika-s0102t3:73_0: But in that he showed the great noise of conduct, the Great King Mahāsudassana, the educated great kingdom with the variety of thoughts, and the human ability to attain this attainment of knowledge and vision, and so on; then having entered upon that meditation subject of the noble ones, solitary retreat and dreams, wherever he was established in a state of loss.
ai-tika-s0102t3:74_0: This householder was reborn in a good family, and it seems, the householder Nakula’s father, “Suppose”, etc., was told by the Buddha and so on.
ai-tika-s0102t3:74_1: But that fever is well-planted here in the Remaine of the Commentaries, but the bone is included in the same way.
ai-tika-s0102t3:74_2: And here there is no share in which to be shared.
ai-tika-s0102t3:75_0: The Longer Discourse on the Licchavīs
